title: Front Fork - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Raise and Support the Front of the Motorcycle
Raise and support the front of the motorcycle.
Do not allow a brake component to hang unsupported on the brake hose or line.
Brake hoses or lines that are not supported may become damaged or bent.
Bent or damaged brake hoses or lines lead to reduced braking efficiency causing loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Note the routing of the ABS wheel speed sensor harness for installation.
There is a shim between the ABS wheel speed sensor and the front fork leg.
Release the fixing and detach the ABS wheel speed sensor from the left hand fork leg, and collect the shim(s).

body.name: Detach front speed sensor DV cjbb_1

body.body: If the forks are to be dismantled, Loosen the fork top caps.
Loosen the upper yoke pinch bolt.
Note the orientation and position of the clutch cable guide and loosen its fixing.
Note the orientation and position of the direction indicators on the forks, and remove the direction indicator bracket pinch bolt.
Loosen the lower yoke pinch bolts and slide the fork down through the yokes.
Care must be taken when removing the forks, to ensure that the outer surfaces do not become scratched.
As the fork is released, remove the clutch cable guide.
As the fork is released, slide the direction indicator brackets off the fork and tie aside. Do not allow the direction indicators to hang on the wiring harnesses.
Remove the forks from the lower yoke.
